com.googlecode.aluminumproject.cli

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.cli.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Alu, AluDoc

    public abstract class Command
extends Object
    A command that will be executed from a command line. JOpt Simple will be used to parse the command-line parameters.

    Subclasses should add all of the options that they support. The following options are added by default:

    • The debug option (--debug), that logs debug statements to the output stream;
    • The help option (-h or --help), that makes sure that when the command is executed, a help message is printed to the output stream;
    • The stack trace option (--print-stack-traces), that causes exceptions to print their stack traces to the error stream.
    When a command is executed, its options are processed first. After that, the execute method is invoked with the command-line arguments that do not belong to any option.

      • addOption

        protected <T> void addOption(OptionSpec<T> option,
                 OptionEffect<T> effect)
        Adds an option and the effect that it has when it is supplied.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the option's argument
        Parameters:
        option - the option to accept
        effect - the effect of the option

      • setDisplayHelp

        public void setDisplayHelp(boolean displayHelp)
        Sets whether a help message should be displayed or not.
        Parameters:
        displayHelp - true to display a help message when this command is executed or false (the default) to actually execute it

      • setLogLevel

        public void setLogLevel(ch.qos.logback.classic.Level logLevel)
        Sets the threshold at which log statements will be printed.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - the log level to use

      • setPrintStackTraces

        public void setPrintStackTraces(boolean printStackTraces)
        Sets whether stack traces of exceptions are printed. They aren't by default.
        Parameters:
        printStackTraces - true to print stack traces to the error stream, false to hide them from the user

      • execute

        public final int execute(PrintStream outputStream,
          PrintStream errorStream,
          String... parameters)
        Executes this command.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - the stream to write output to
        errorStream - the stream to write errors to
        parameters - the command-line parameters
        Returns:
        the termination status of this command: zero if its execution was successful, nonzero if it wasn't

      • execute

        protected abstract void execute(PrintStream outputStream,
           PrintStream errorStream,
           List<String> arguments)
                         throws AluminumException
        Executes this command.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - the output stream to use
        errorStream - the error stream to use
        arguments - the command-line arguments that do not belong to any option
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this command can't be executed

      • displayHelp

        protected void displayHelp(PrintStream outputStream)
                    throws AluminumException
        Displays a help message.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - the output stream to print the help message to
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the help message can't be displayed

      • getHelpInformation

        protected abstract Map<String,String> getHelpInformation()
        Returns information that will be used in the help message. It can contain the following keys, all of which are optional:
        name
        The name of the command;
        description
        A description of the command;
        usage
        A description of how the command can be used.
        Returns:
        help information about this command
